radiographic_examinations.findings: Dense calcification involving basal ganglia and periventricular gray matter structures.
Calcification in the basal ganglia, primarily involving the putamen.
Calcification in the putamen, caudate, pulvinar, deep sulci of the frontal cortex, and dentate nuclei.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive intellectual decline was noted; IQ decreased from 167 to 120.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Extensive calcification of the basal ganglia, caudate nuclei, thalami, and dentate nuclei of the cerebellum.
Massive intracranial calcification involving the basal ganglia, cerebellum, and cerebral white matter.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrence of severe dysarthria and emotional lability one year after the initial incident, with emergence of parkinsonian features.
